snippet: Jeremy Lin is heading to Houston, leaving a legion of heartbroken Knicks fans behind.
abstract: New York Knicks decide not to match offer by Houston Rockets for point guard Jeremy Lin, ending a brief, spectacular and now-bittersweet love affair between Lin and an adoring fan base; Lin's contract contains a third-year balloon payment of $14.9 million, which would have cost the Knicks another $35 million or more in luxury-tax penalties.

byline.contributor: Nate Taylor contributed reporting from Las Vegas.

lead_paragraph: Jeremy Lin is heading to Houston, leaving a legion of heartbroken Knicks fans behind.

headline.seo: Knicks Now Seem Set on Letting Lin Go
headline.main: Knicks Make It Official: Lin Is Gone
